commit_message:
Check if container is running before doing an exec

container_running is a new method which will allow to return True if a
container is detected as running or False if not running.
There is a retry mechanism which if "podman ps" is used, will add "--sync" to
the command so we synchronize the state of OCI runtime. Before doing a
"podman ps", we try to check if the service is running in systemd.
There is a very short sleep between the retries to give a chance to
podman to find the container if it takes a bit of time to start or seen
as started.

It will be used by the builder when a container is configured to
run "podman exec"; we'll first verify that the container exist otherwise
return an error and stop the deployment.

This patch is mainly a workaround against a race condition where in
heavy-loaded environments, an exec can be run too early in a step where
the container is still starting.

It also consolidate the discover_container_name method in order to get
more chance to actually get a name.

Co-Authored-By: Cdric Jeanneret <cjeanner@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1839559
Change-Id: If4d8c268218bf83abed877a699fc583fb55ccbed
(cherry picked from commit 983ab98f61f530eec7cac31e3a0556bf6722e2a0)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/paunch refs/changes/71/678071/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Before running the exec, we want to make sure the container # is running. # https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1839559 is_systemd = (restart != 'none' and self.runner.cont_cmd == 'podman') if not self.runner.container_running(container, self.config_id, is_systemd): return

subject: Fix idempotency on RHEL8
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-08-28 14:23:42.000000000', 'files': ['paunch/builder/base.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/paunch/commit/2ed3e83fdefb965ca62234a1657fc95dc6a27e99', 'message': 'Fix idempotency on RHEL8

On RHEL8, podman is shipped by default with podman-docker which installs
an alias so the operators can still use "docker" CLI, but the command
will be converted to run "podman" instead:

  Emulate Docker CLI using podman. Create /etc/containers/nodocker to quiet msg

We don't want to remove the rpm or create /etc/containers/nodocker so
the operators have the warning and now we are moving to Podman by
default.

So we need to change Paunch to detect if Docker was actually running
before removing docker-managed containers, instead of using 'which
docker', we'll check for the actual docker socket if it exists.

Co-Authored-By: Cdric Jeanneret <cjeanner@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I628c2fe7e962412f0d7e1c3e044d02c5a2fabd77
'}]
commit_message:
Fix idempotency on RHEL8

On RHEL8, podman is shipped by default with podman-docker which installs
an alias so the operators can still use "docker" CLI, but the command
will be converted to run "podman" instead:

  Emulate Docker CLI using podman. Create /etc/containers/nodocker to quiet msg

We don't want to remove the rpm or create /etc/containers/nodocker so
the operators have the warning and now we are moving to Podman by
default.

So we need to change Paunch to detect if Docker was actually running
before removing docker-managed containers, instead of using 'which
docker', we'll check for the actual docker socket if it exists.

Co-Authored-By: Cdric Jeanneret <cjeanner@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I628c2fe7e962412f0d7e1c3e044d02c5a2fabd77
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/paunch refs/changes/69/679069/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import os if self.runner.cont_cmd == 'podman' and \ os.path.exists('/var/run/docker.sock'):

commit_message:
Use /var/tmp on host to store temporal files for image upload via Horizon

Previously we use /tmp inside horizon container to store temporal files
for image upload via Horizon, but this makes the image size grow for
each upload operation.

This patch makes sure that we use host directory to store temporal
file, so that it is not written inside container.

Change-Id: Ic32e7a2db83bb5a0fb3c69708be9be96435dd030
Closes-Bug: 1840607
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/07/677107/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: horizon::file_upload_temp_dir: '/var/tmp' - /var/tmp/:/var/tmp/:z

commit_message:
Ensure SG is only deleted in case it's present in the KuryrNet CRD

In case Namespace Isolation is not enforced no SG is created and
added to the KuryrNet CRD. Right now, when an exception occurred
on the KuryrNet CRD addition, we try to delete a SG that was not
created.
This commit fixes the issue by checking for the existence of the
sgID in the CRD pior to deleting it.

Change-Id: I4ad3886398138d9a4a8e483b66b3573200002a0c
Closes-Bug: 1841765
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes refs/changes/36/679036/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if net_crd_sg.get('sgId'): self._drv_sg.delete_sg(net_crd_sg['sgId'])

commit_message:
Add undercloud-key-file and ssh_network options.

To enable the execution via ssh into the Undercloud node it's
required to pass also the ansible_ssh_user private key. This
options is part of the tripleo_common inventory.py, but defaults
to None.
This patch allows to pass this parameter in case it's needed.

Also, this patch allows to pass a different value for the host_network
parameter in TripleoInventory instantiation. Setting it by default to
ctlplane.

Change-Id: Id303f356c1b06906aa5aae43b0032bb80a712508
Related-Bug: #1832932
(cherry picked from commit db30779959c78208b39e716c946152ae8f7e904c)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-validations refs/changes/77/677777/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cfg.StrOpt('undercloud-key-file', default=None), undercloud_connection=configs.undercloud_connection, undercloud_key_file=configs.undercloud_key_file)

subject: Pass neutron-ovs.yaml environment in upgrade prepare.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-08-28 10:01:26.000000000', 'files': ['templates/overcloud_upgrade_prepare.sh.j2', 'tasks/common/auxilary-facts.yaml', 'tasks/upgrade/overcloud_upgrade_prepare.yml', 'templates/overcloud_upgrade_converge.sh.j2', 'tasks/upgrade/configure_uc_containers.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-upgrade/commit/725d24ab3c9890098b6a3072a2d783445e3f9e2f', 'message': 'Pass neutron-ovs.yaml environment in upgrade prepare.

If the environmet is deployed in Rocky with OVS then we need to pass
the neutron-ovs.yml environment file for the upgrade prepare and converge
steps to work. Otherwise, as OVN is the Neutron engine by default in
Stein it will try to deploy with OVN and the upgrade will fail.

Also, the containers-prepare-parameter.yaml is shared between the UC
and the OC upgrade. For the case of the UC, there is no possibility to
deploy with ovn, so we force the neutron_driver option (defaulted to ovn
when creating the default containers-prepare-parameter.yaml file) to
openvswitch. However, for the OC, we need to identify if it was deployed
with the OVN service enabled and if so, set the netron_driver to ovn instead.

In summary, we first upgrade from Rocky with OVS to Stein with OVS and
if required, a post-upgrade step to upgrade from OVS to OVN would be
performed. In the case the Rocky deployment was with OVN enabled we
perform a Rocky with OVN to Stein with OVN upgrade.

Change-Id: I21bbf9cda977a1c269e2c1caad4bf88d3f6173b0
(cherry picked from commit bb44ee55a3057540ffd05a4b55f8ccff9294f3e0)
'}]
commit_message:
Pass neutron-ovs.yaml environment in upgrade prepare.

If the environmet is deployed in Rocky with OVS then we need to pass
the neutron-ovs.yml environment file for the upgrade prepare and converge
steps to work. Otherwise, as OVN is the Neutron engine by default in
Stein it will try to deploy with OVN and the upgrade will fail.

Also, the containers-prepare-parameter.yaml is shared between the UC
and the OC upgrade. For the case of the UC, there is no possibility to
deploy with ovn, so we force the neutron_driver option (defaulted to ovn
when creating the default containers-prepare-parameter.yaml file) to
openvswitch. However, for the OC, we need to identify if it was deployed
with the OVN service enabled and if so, set the netron_driver to ovn instead.

In summary, we first upgrade from Rocky with OVS to Stein with OVS and
if required, a post-upgrade step to upgrade from OVS to OVN would be
performed. In the case the Rocky deployment was with OVN enabled we
perform a Rocky with OVN to Stein with OVN upgrade.

Change-Id: I21bbf9cda977a1c269e2c1caad4bf88d3f6173b0
(cherry picked from commit bb44ee55a3057540ffd05a4b55f8ccff9294f3e0)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-upgrade refs/changes/18/679018/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Set the neutron_driver to openvswitch for the Undercloud replace: path: "{{ working_dir }}/{{ uc_containers_prepare_file }}" regexp: '^(\s*neutron_driver\s*:)(.*)' replace: '\1 openvswitch'

subject: Do request_log middleware next to last
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-07-26 17:53:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/placement/commit/ce5690afe48d861d462cefd142cb77619797a953', 'message': "Do request_log middleware last

While trying to track down a global_request_id problem, I added some
debug logging into RequestLog [1] but the x-openstack-request-id was not
emitted:

headers: [('Content-Length', '162'),
         ('Content-Type', 'application/json'),
         ('openstack-api-version', 'placement 1.8'),
         ('vary', 'openstack-api-version')]

It turns out we were hitting the request_log middleware before the
req_id_middleware.

Even though we don't (currently) log headers under normal circumstances,
the logger should have a crack at the request in a form as close as
possible to what's going to be sent across the wire. So this commit
moves request_log last in the chain.

After this change, the above becomes:

headers: [('Content-Length', '162'),
         ('Content-Type', 'application/json'),
         ('openstack-api-version', 'placement 1.8'),
         ('vary', 'openstack-api-version'),
         ('x-openstack-request-id', 'req-99385d48-0860-48ff-a4a4-a2423153f0f2')]

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/672984/

Change-Id: I5a80056dd88836a4e79a649fa02d36dc7e75eee4

commit_message:
Do request_log middleware next to last

While trying to track down a global_request_id problem, I added some
debug logging into RequestLog [1] but the x-openstack-request-id was not
emitted:

headers: [('Content-Length', '162'),
         ('Content-Type', 'application/json'),
         ('openstack-api-version', 'placement 1.8'),
         ('vary', 'openstack-api-version')]

It turns out the request_log middleware and req_id_middleware were not
interacting well. We need to establish the request id, from incoming
headers, first, then as soon as we can, start logging. Then we want the
final log to be as near the end of the request as possible.

Even though we don't (currently) log headers under normal circumstances,
the logger should have a crack at the request in a form as close as
possible to what's going to be sent across the wire. So this commit
moves request_log to next to last in the chain.

After this change, the above becomes:

headers: [('Content-Length', '162'),
         ('Content-Type', 'application/json'),
         ('openstack-api-version', 'placement 1.8'),
         ('vary', 'openstack-api-version'),
         ('x-openstack-request-id', 'req-99385d48-0860-48ff-a4a4-a2423153f0f2')]

Note that reordering broke an unrelated test that was expecting
environ['REMOTE_ADDR'], which isn't set in the "blank" Request being
used, so this is addressed as well.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/672984/

Change-Id: I5a80056dd88836a4e79a649fa02d36dc7e75eee4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/placement refs/changes/27/673027/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Uncap kombu

The related bug was fixed in eventlet 0.25.1, so we can now uncap kombu,
reverting [1], and instead blacklist eventlet 0.25.0. The latter was
done by [2]; this commit does the former.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/677070/
[2] I39ed2c57015fcd291868e20fe2f3b657aa8f4eb3

Change-Id: I9b314283434791d808984a810508dc028484ba5d
Related-Bug: #1840551

to be created. This commit increases the timeout.

commit_message:
Ensure Pod IP is retrieved after pod is annoated with the VIF

When a pod takes a while to get annotated with the VIF information,
the retrieval of the pod IP from the annotations might fail due to
missing annotation, causing the controller to restart.
This commit fixes the issue by ensuring the pod IP is only retrieved
after the pod is annotated.

Change-Id: Iac1570b76783d532b77e7d8be96f2b71a19f8409
Closes-Bug: 1841758

commit_message:
Improve new scheduler

* Changed method get_scheduled_jobs_count() in the Scheduler
  interface to has_scheduled_jobs(). In fact, the callers
  always need to compare the number of jobs with 0, i.e.
  to see if there are any jobs or not. But more importantly,
  this semantics (returning just boolean) allows to make a
  good optimisation for DefaultScheduler and avoid DB calls
  in a number of cases. Practically, for example, it saves
  several seconds (5-6) if we run a workflow with 500 parallel
  no-op tasks that are all merged with one "join" task. Tested
  on 1 and 2 engines.
* Added test assertions for has_scheduled_jobs()
* Other minor chagnes

Change-Id: Ife48d9e464114fd60a08707d8f32f847a6f623c9

commit_message:
Flag safe usage of sha1 w/ #nosec

This tells bandit that this usage of sha1 is not
interesting for security scans.

Change-Id: Ibc0f75d9eef04c919410cafb1a1713d6470f8142

commit_message:
Delete redundant code

Method _discover_mpath_device isn't overwrited in FibreChannelConnector,
just use it by self._discover_mpath_device.

Change-Id: I3d5a6e0010e56d256da17e4b20be3db0569c6702
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-brick refs/changes/53/672853/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: (device_path, multipath_id) = (super( FibreChannelConnector, self)._discover_mpath_device( device_wwn, connection_properties, self.device_name))

commit_message:
Set provisioning and cleaning networks as non-shared

Modifies provisioning and cleaning networks in multi-tenant ironic
environments to be non-shared. Flat networks remain shared.

To apply the change to an existing environment, run 'kayobe overcloud
post configure'.

Change-Id: Ie59f0c729381e5bea112ab7f5d0c738a9488b772
Story: 2006409
Task: 36295
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kayobe refs/changes/07/676907/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | Modifies provisioning and cleaning networks in multi-tenant ironic environments to be non-shared. Flat networks remain shared. To apply the change to an existing environment, run `kayobe overcloud post configure`. See `story 2006409 <https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2006409>`__ for details.

kata has its own tenant.

Run kata static checks

These static checks run as part of the existing jenkins job [0] so we
add it to the new zuul job.

[0] https://github.com/kata-containers/tests/blob/master/.ci/jenkins_job_build.sh#L102-L104

Change-Id: I45d9eae77080828a81423e2874f23cb5a4af1b24

commit_message:
Fixing dn_to_id function for cases were id is not in the DN

The more common scenario to return the uid as part of the RDN in a DN,
However, it's a valid case to not have the uid in the RDN, so we need to
search in the LDAP based on the DN and return the uid in the entire object.

Also, we do not support multivalued attribute id on DN, so the test case
covering this case, it was adjusted for raise NotFound.

Closes-Bug: 1782922
Change-Id: I87a3bfa94b5907ce4c6b4eb8e124ec948b390bf2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/77/649177/17 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _dn_to_id(self, dn): # Check if the naming attribute in the DN is the same as keystone's # configured 'id' attribute'. If so, extract the ID value from the import pdb; pdb.set_trace() if self.id_attr == utf8_decode( ldap.dn.str2dn(utf8_encode(dn))[0][0][0].lower()): return utf8_decode(ldap.dn.str2dn(utf8_encode(dn))[0][0][1]) else: # The 'ID' attribute is NOT in the DN, so we need to perform an # LDAP search to look it up from the user entry itself. with self.get_connection() as conn: search_result = conn.search_s(dn, self.LDAP_SCOPE) if search_result: return search_result[0][1][self.id_attr][0] else: message = _('DN attribute %(dn)s not found in LDAP') % ( {'dn': dn}) raise exception.NotFound(message=message)

commit_message:
Manages build reqs in python-redfish project

python-redfish can benefit from zuul v3 new feature allowing management
of build requiremetns into the project instead of centrally in
project-config. First step is to remove these build requiremetns from
it with this commit (except publish-to-pyi).

Change-Id: Idf857cb0e48ff4e7d4b283d7b203870c41e3fb67

commit_message:
Increase timeout for promote-openstack-manuals

openstack-manuals publishing takes a long time, it can run 1250 (fast)
or timeout (1803s), increase the timeout by 50 per cent.

Change-Id: I9312ae3a8345810337d16d929f396fbe2d4d5208

commit_message:
Honor blocking=True for the etcd aquire method

In the event that there is a spurious connectvity issue with the
etcd service, then the self.client.put opertaion will fail with
a RequestException. The will result in the current lock no longer
being a blocking operation.

This was a result of commit 1a57bbcc24021a6c237cad6a26f5035f0fc8fa92

Fixes-bug: #1841077
Change-Id: I6010d8d8e066ba0dec820c365bcbf2e2dd93a685

commit_message:
Revert "Handle defined containers that are stopped."

The proposed solution breaks pacemaker-managed containers,
see bz#1745950.

FWIW this only fix a corner case where the operators stopped the containers and want to run a tripleo operation
e.g. major upgrade.

We are proposing a revert to unblock downstream and
we'll have to rework this patch.

This reverts commit 85fb2ed4d3f7e42840842f2bdec617e33d6ba4ef.

Change-Id: I8a27b92498d832698ba4d55bed1b2adcf2c1e3eb
(cherry picked from commit e500ba926220039bc8709778285ef16dabfe2b96)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/paunch refs/changes/59/678859/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # inspect two # rm two, changed config data # inspect three ('a\nb\nc', '', 0)
deleted_lines: # inspect config data for two, we made it changed # rm two # inspect config data for three # inspect state for three ('[{"State": {"Running": true}}]', '', 0), ('a\nb\nc', '', 0), # check container three status via inspect mock.call(['docker', 'inspect', '--type', 'container', 'three-12345678'], mock.ANY, False), @mock.patch('paunch.runner.DockerRunner.execute') @mock.patch('paunch.runner.DockerRunner.remove_container') @mock.patch('paunch.builder.base.BaseBuilder.pull_missing_images') @mock.patch('paunch.builder.base.BaseBuilder.delete_missing_and_updated') @mock.patch('paunch.runner.DockerRunner.container_names') @mock.patch('paunch.runner.DockerRunner.unique_container_name') @mock.patch('paunch.runner.DockerRunner.discover_container_name') @mock.patch('paunch.runner.DockerRunner.inspect') def test_recreate_stopped_container(self, inspect, discover_container_name, unique_container_name, container_names, delete_missing_and_updated, pull_missing_images, remove_container, execute): orig_call = tenacity.wait.wait_random_exponential.__call__ orig_argspec = inspect.getargspec(orig_call) config = { # not running yet 'one': { 'start_order': 0, 'image': 'centos:7' } } r = runner.DockerRunner(managed_by='tester', cont_cmd='docker') with mock.patch('tenacity.wait.wait_random_exponential.__call__') as f: f.return_value = 0 with mock.patch('inspect.getargspec') as mock_args: mock_args.return_value = orig_argspec builder = compose1.ComposeV1Builder('foo', config, r) pull_missing_images.return_value = 0 # No value is returned delete_missing_and_updated.return_value = None container_names.return_value = [['one', 'one']] unique_container_name.return_value = 'one' # This can be a no-op since inspect_container() uses this return value # and that will also be overridden. discover_container_name.return_value = None inspect.return_value = {"State": {"Running": False}} remove_container.return_value = ('stdout', 'stderr', 0) execute.return_value = ('stdout', 'stderr', 0) # Run the main apply() method for this test. stdout, stderr, deploy_status_code = builder.apply() pull_missing_images.assert_called_once() container_names.assert_called_once() unique_container_name.assert_called_once() delete_missing_and_updated.assert_called()

This review updates the fs to match fs001 more closely.

commit_message:
Ensure controller is only restarted after the event timesout

It can take a while for a pod to have annotations and a hostIP
defined. It is also possible that a pod is deleted before
the state is set, causing a NotFound k8s exception. Lastly,
a service migth be missing the lbaas_spec annotation, causing
the event handled on the endpoints to crash. All this scenarios
can be avoided by raising a resource not ready exception, which
allows the operation to be retried.

Change-Id: I5476cd4261a6118dbb388d7238e83169439ffe0d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes refs/changes/37/677837/13 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: pod_name = pod['metadata']['name'] LOG.warning("Pod %s has not been scheduled yet.", pod_name) raise exceptions.ResourceNotReady(pod)
deleted_lines: LOG.warning("Pod has not been scheduled yet.") raise

commit_message:
Add LibvirtTLSPriority to set libvirtd tls_priority

Adds LibvirtTLSPriority parameter to override the compile time
default TLS priority string.
Default: 'NORMAL:-VERS-SSL3.0:-VERS-TLS-ALL:+VERS-TLS1.2'

Conflicts:
      deployment/nova/nova-libvirt-container-puppet.yaml

Removed the conflict, as this file is not present in Queens
release and corresponding changes are done in
puppet/services/nova-libvirt.yaml file.

Change-Id: Id05c5e88be2d9f90642ed5159cb2db03c997f83a
Closes-Bug: #1840447
(cherry picked from commit 56ccd717d48aca2d3138c1f4416baa72d3655216)
(cherry picked from commit 393f43a664b16fe284b54c75320a2c7f09d18579)
(cherry picked from commit 9a31aafd33da991a9ea5d8b1cc70f6151ce06255)

added_lines: --- features: - | Adds LibvirtTLSPriority parameter to override the compile time default TLS priority string. Default: 'NORMAL:-VERS-SSL3.0:-VERS-TLS-ALL:+VERS-TLS1.2'

commit_message:
Release kuryr-tempest-plugin 0.5.0

In order to unblock removal of openshift Python library dependency, we
need a release of kuryr-tempest-plugin that will not use it. In order to
do that this commit switches its release model to
cycle-with-intermediary and creates a 0.5.0 release. More info can be
found on openstack-discuss [1]

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-August/008667.html

Change-Id: Iff90f2b643744b1dd63c8f15e1a72b879ee9a720
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/releases refs/changes/42/678542/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Allow the execution of leapp without RHSM subscription.

There are a set of workarounds which can be executed in order
skip the RHSM subscription requirement to run the Leapp tool. This
patch includes an option leapp_unsubscribed, a boolean, that when
setted to true enables an environment variable LEAPP_DEVEL_SKIP_RHSM
which skips the subscription check.

Change-Id: Ifca276dabad3c87f86681704d4fad0658c66f4b2
(cherry picked from commit 7866adeba05e6a843c5c5901d074f7953aa34e0c)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-upgrade refs/changes/99/678999/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Run leapp upgrade without RHSM subscription # Requires workarounds being applied. leapp_unsubscribed: false

subject: Set EnablePackageInstall to true by default for in-place OS upgrade
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-08-28 06:53:03.000000000', 'files': ['environments/lifecycle/upgrade-converge.yaml', 'environments/lifecycle/upgrade-prepare.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/3f576469144311ff822884651d0717ee8836f02c', 'message': 'Set EnablePackageInstall to true by default for in-place OS upgrade

For in-place upgrades via Leapp, which is the default, we are
dependent on package installs. User can still override the default

some manual means.

Change-Id: I5e5629d2baed97988bc65151d51c115a2a263dfc

(cherry picked from commit 86d425601495550282119be035180bdbc71cfc57)

commit_message:
Set EnablePackageInstall to true by default for in-place OS upgrade

For in-place upgrades via Leapp, which is the default, we are
dependent on package installs. User can still override the default
value if they wish so, but they might have to pull in the content by
some manual means.

Change-Id: I5e5629d2baed97988bc65151d51c115a2a263dfc
Partial-Bug: #1831690
(cherry picked from commit 86d425601495550282119be035180bdbc71cfc57)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/03/679003/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: EnablePackageInstall: true

commit_message:
[WIP][POC] Allow guest-agent get conf files via tftp

This patch will bring conf files from controller into instances.
We are needing to add TFTP_ENABLE=True during build guest images
through Diskimage-builder (DIB). It's a solution more secure than
SCP/SSh from controller.

Change-Id: I2cb0dd2906c77b86acb199133997922fed8c0c5e

commit_message:
Handle already created objects in "test_update_timpestamp"

In [1], if the waiting loop is executed more than once, the previously
created objects should be deleted first to avoid the problem related in
[2].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/678262
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1841183/comments/3

Change-Id: I86cd17be6a776e4598abaeeb63de2eecbf0a64f9
Related-Bug: #1841183

commit_message:
Add LibvirtTLSPriority to set libvirtd tls_priority

Adds LibvirtTLSPriority parameter to override the compile time
default TLS priority string.
Default: 'NORMAL:-VERS-SSL3.0:-VERS-TLS-ALL:+VERS-TLS1.2'

Conflicts:
      deployment/nova/nova-libvirt-container-puppet.yaml

Removed the conflict, as this file is not present in Rocky
release and corresponding changes are done in
puppet/services/nova-libvirt.yaml file.

Change-Id: Id05c5e88be2d9f90642ed5159cb2db03c997f83a
Closes-Bug: #1840447
(cherry picked from commit 56ccd717d48aca2d3138c1f4416baa72d3655216)
(cherry picked from commit 393f43a664b16fe284b54c75320a2c7f09d18579)

subject: Create supplemental node volume in correct volume pool
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-07-12 20:20:35.000000000', 'files': ['roles/libvirt/setup/supplemental/templates/tls_everywhere_provisioner.sh.j2'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/commit/8298e3775254840cf0a36cfb5f26f92770ca980a', 'message': "Create supplemental node volume in correct volume pool

The tls_everywhere_provisioner.sh script creates the supplementatal
node but fails to create it in the libvirt volume pool. This mean the
idempotent check (below) fails.

- name: Check if the supplemental node volume already exists
  command: >
    virsh vol-info --pool '{{ libvirt_volume_pool }}'
    '{{ supplemental_node.name }}.qcow2'

And because virt-install creates a pool of it's choosing unknown to
oooq the pool is never cleaned up, a resource leakage.

This patch uses virsh to create the supplemental volume in the
libvirt_volume_pool where all the other node volumes are located and
then uses virsh again to upload the image into that
volume. virt-install will discover the disk image is already present
in a known pool and hence will not create a new pool.

Change-Id: Ie34233b7930badf41023635064286d2cdaab0b71
Closes-Bug: 1833456
Signed-off-by: John Dennis <jdennis@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Create supplemental node volume in correct volume pool

The tls_everywhere_provisioner.sh script creates the supplementatal
node but fails to create it in the libvirt volume pool. This mean the
idempotent check (below) fails.

- name: Check if the supplemental node volume already exists
  command: >
    virsh vol-info --pool '{{ libvirt_volume_pool }}'
    '{{ supplemental_node.name }}.qcow2'

And because virt-install creates a pool of it's choosing unknown to
oooq the pool is never cleaned up, a resource leakage.

This patch uses virsh to create the supplemental volume in the
libvirt_volume_pool where all the other node volumes are located and
then uses virsh again to upload the image into that
volume. virt-install will discover the disk image is already present
in a known pool and hence will not create a new pool.

Change-Id: Ie34233b7930badf41023635064286d2cdaab0b71
Closes-Bug: 1833456
Signed-off-by: John Dennis <jdennis@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/46/670646/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: POOL_NAME={{ libvirt_volume_pool }} POOL_PATH={{ libvirt_volume_path }} IMG_NAME=ipa.qcow2 VMIMGIPA={{ working_dir }}/$IMG_NAME VMIMGIPACOPY={{ working_dir }}/ORIG-$IMG_NAME VOL_IMG_PATH=$POOL_PATH/$IMG_NAME# We want the supplemental node to be a member of the correct volume # pool. If we provide virt-install with just a path to the image # then virt-install will create a pool and volumne for the image # and we will have lost knowledge of where virsh is maintaining # the image. So create a volume in the desired pool of the correct # size and then upload our image into that pool/volume. Then tell # virt-install what the path is to the volume. virt-install will be # able to determine the volume and pool from the path. VOL_SIZE=`qemu-img info --output=json $VMIMGIPA | \ python -c "import sys,json; \ info=json.load(sys.stdin); print(info['virtual-size'])"` virsh vol-create-as $POOL_NAME $IMG_NAME $VOL_SIZE --format qcow2 virsh vol-upload --pool $POOL_NAME $IMG_NAME $VMIMGIPA --disk path=$VOL_IMG_PATH,format=qcow2 \
deleted_lines: WORKDIR=/tmp/virt-undercloud-$(date +%s) VMIMGIPA={{ working_dir }}/ipa.qcow2 VMIMGIPACOPY={{ working_dir }}/ORIG-ipa.qcow2 --disk path=$VMIMGIPA \

commit_message:
Pass undercloud's private key to inventory used in package_update.

As the Ansible playbook is being executed from the mistral_executor
container, we need to establish a conection to the Undercloud via ssh
not local as it was being done up to now. In order to be able to ssh
into the host we need to provide with the tripleo-ansible's user ssh
key.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/676415/

Closes-Bug: #1832932
Change-Id: I20948d49b3023dc76acff8779bbe182886e55838
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/27/676427/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: '--undercloud-key-file', '/var/lib/mistral/.ssh/tripleo-admin-rsa',

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-08-23 22:28:14.000000000', 'files': ['docker/services/novajoin.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/973ae3e83cbe80e2e4858903c10eab257bad52a2', 'message': 'Explicitly set notification driver for novajoin

Novajoin is reliant on some notifications from nova. We recently merged
an update to the undercloud installation that disables the notification
drvier across the board if telemetry is disabled. This change adds a
service_config_setting for nova to force the notification driver to
messagingv2. This should be merged with the service configurations and
override the value that is normally set via NotificationDriver.

Change-Id: Ifee8f7f50fc2ef99605cbbcaa89016514b80b561

commit_message:
Explicitly set notification driver for novajoin

Novajoin is reliant on some notifications from nova. We recently merged
an update to the undercloud installation that disables the notification
drvier across the board if telemetry is disabled. This change adds a
service_config_setting for nova to force the notification driver to
messagingv2. This should be merged with the service configurations and
override the value that is normally set via NotificationDriver.

Change-Id: Ifee8f7f50fc2ef99605cbbcaa89016514b80b561
Closes-Bug: #1841100
(cherry picked from commit 7c9c363c789811d54353d769aab86774eb5c96f8)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/16/678316/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # novajoin requires that the notification driver be set which could # be disabled if telemetry is off. nova::notification_driver: messagingv2

commit_message:
Choose first node as bootstrap node name/ip

Previously when Heat was choosing the bootstrap node, it always chose
the first node due to the ResourceGroup ordering.

When it was switched to ansible, the last node was chosen instead due to
unpredictable dict sorting from the inventory.

This patch restores the previous behavior and makes sure the first node
in a group is chosen as the bootstrap node for the both the name
and ip if the sorted_bootstrap_node variable is set.

The variable is used so that the tripleo-heat-templates patch and this
patch can merge, otherwise they'd block each other from merging.

See I6b93f5b0747c5a11d24615a3bbb5516f9be81401 for the
tripleo-heat-templates patch.

Change-Id: I3d595ea5b84f940a3b2dbc69798f69fe03529c10

commit_message:
Update api-ref location

The api documentation is now published on docs.openstack.org instead
of developer.openstack.org. Update all links that are changed to the
new location.

Note that redirects will be set up as well but let's point now to the
new location.

For details, see:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-July/007828.html

Change-Id: If2443f0aafc82e78c4adeea4bbf8d5fd60ad6e58

subject: Remove 'hw:cpu_policy', 'hw:mem_page_size' extra specs from API samples
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-08-08 13:34:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/f662660691bafe42a915cc24cc5b32c3b0d44d41', 'message': "Remove 'hw:cpu_policy', 'hw:mem_page_size' extra specs from API samples

In a future change, the use of 'hw:cpu_policy' will require a host to
report PCPU inventory. Rather than modify the fake driver used in these
tests to report such inventory, just use a different extra spec,
'hw:numa_nodes'. This has the added bonus of being supported by both the
libvirt and Hyper-V virt drivers, unlike 'hw:cpu_policy' and
'hw:mem_page_size', which are only supported by the libvirt virt driver.

Change-Id: Id203dc07f08557b1b094ec72e1df3493ec9524b1
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove 'hw:cpu_policy', 'hw:mem_page_size' extra specs from API samples

In a future change, the use of 'hw:cpu_policy' will require a host to
report PCPU inventory. Rather than modify the fake driver used in these
tests to report such inventory, just use a different extra spec,
'hw:numa_nodes'. This has the added bonus of being supported by both the
libvirt and Hyper-V virt drivers, unlike 'hw:cpu_policy' and
'hw:mem_page_size', which are only supported by the libvirt virt driver.

Change-Id: Id203dc07f08557b1b094ec72e1df3493ec9524b1
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/38/675338/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: "hw:numa_nodes": "1"

subject: Add support for IBM SVC
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-03-27 18:52:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinderlib/commit/13f98cb4921db2c0174515397b1ca711c005ff7d', 'message': 'Add support for IBM SVC

When initializing IBM SVC with the memory persistence we get an exception:

  return IMPL.volume_get_all_by_host(context, host, filters=filters)
  AttributeError: 'DB' object has no attribute 'volume_get_all_by_host'

The issue is caused by the SVC driver accessing the database directly,
which is not considered good practice in Cinder nowadays.

The problem with drivers using the DB directly is that cinderlib doesn't
require a DB, it can work storing everything in memory. To facilitate
storage of the resources' metadata cinderlib has its own persistence
plugin mechanism, and has some ad-hoc "workarounds" in the DB class for
drivers that access the DB directly.

The IBM driver has the following DB dependencies:

- volume_get_all_by_host when using objects.VolumeList.get_all_by_host

- volume_type_get when using objects.VolumeType.get_by_name_or_id

- volume_type_get_by_name when using
  objects.VolumeType.get_by_name_or_id

- volume_get directly called by get_by_id when using
  objects.Volume.get_by_id

- _group_type_get_full directly called by get_by_id when using
  objects.GroupType.get_by_id

In cinderlib we don't currently support groups or consistency groups, so
we don't need to implement `_group_type_get_full` and we have already
implemented workaround for methods `volume_get` and `volume_type_get`,
so this patch implements the remaining 2 methods volume_get_all_by_host
and volume_type_get_by_name in the DB class.

Closes-Bug: #1821898
Change-Id: I94b4864c5823976f4a9cac2e40943b74aca4066e

commit_message:
Add support for IBM SVC

When initializing IBM SVC with the memory persistence we get an exception:

  return IMPL.volume_get_all_by_host(context, host, filters=filters)
  AttributeError: 'DB' object has no attribute 'volume_get_all_by_host'

The issue is caused by the SVC driver accessing the database directly,
which is not considered good practice in Cinder nowadays.

The problem with drivers using the DB directly is that cinderlib doesn't
require a DB, it can work storing everything in memory. To facilitate
storage of the resources' metadata cinderlib has its own persistence
plugin mechanism, and has some ad-hoc "workarounds" in the DB class for
drivers that access the DB directly.

The IBM driver has the following DB dependencies:

- volume_get_all_by_host when using objects.VolumeList.get_all_by_host

- volume_type_get when using objects.VolumeType.get_by_name_or_id

- volume_type_get_by_name when using
  objects.VolumeType.get_by_name_or_id

- volume_get directly called by get_by_id when using
  objects.Volume.get_by_id

- _group_type_get_full directly called by get_by_id when using
  objects.GroupType.get_by_id

- volume_admin_metadata_get direct call

- volume_admin_metadata_update direct call

- volume_admin_metadata_delete direct call

In cinderlib we don't currently support groups or consistency groups, so
we don't need to implement `_group_type_get_full` and we have already
implemented workaround for methods `volume_get` and `volume_type_get`,
so this patch implements the remaining 5 methods volume_get_all_by_host,
volume_type_get_by_name, volume_admin_metadata_get,
volume_admin_metadata_update, and volume_admin_metadata_delete in the DB
class.

Closes-Bug: #1821898
Change-Id: I94b4864c5823976f4a9cac2e40943b74aca4066e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinderlib refs/changes/12/648212/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Our volume type name is the same as the id and the volume name def _volume_type_get_by_name(self, context, name, session=None): return self.volume_type_get(context, name) def volume_get_all_by_host(self, context, host, filters=None): backend_name = host.split('#')[0].split('@')[1] result = self.persistence.get_volumes(backend_name=backend_name) return [vol._ovo for vol in result]

commit_message:
neutron: Fix alias for openstack-neutron-server.service

We want the alias to be available for "systemctl enable" which does
not work when creating it in the [Install] section of the unit file.
Instead we create the alias now by adding the "openstack-neutron"
symlink to the package. As outlined in the systemd.unit(5) man page.

Change-Id: Ifb5d567cc1b7857f0a602018fcc11fcd52e92135
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rpm-packaging refs/changes/48/679048/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ln -s openstack-neutron-server.service %{buildroot}%{_unitdir}/openstack-neutron.service%{_unitdir}/openstack-neutron.service

subject: Submit candidacy for keystone PTL
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-08-23 19:42:09.000000000', 'files': ['candidates/u/Keystone/colleen@gazlene.net'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/election/commit/d2256b60beb397b4801e3b96bd70b072c34eac98', 'message': 'Submit candidacy for keystone PTL

Submitting this early as I will be unavailable during the official
nomination period.

Change-Id: I25dd66b2935a7ebdfdb6f43586faac56c3632620
'}]
commit_message:
Submit candidacy for keystone PTL

Submitting this early as I will be unavailable during the official
nomination period.

Change-Id: I25dd66b2935a7ebdfdb6f43586faac56c3632620
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/election refs/changes/93/678293/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: I'd like to submit my candidacy to remain serving as keystone PTL for the next cycle. It has been my privilege to serve as PTL for this past cycle, during which we made progress on several major issues, especially on transitioning our RBAC model to steer away from the admin-ness problem and to understand read-only roles, as well as enhancing application credentials with fine-grained access control and support for federated users. In the upcoming cycle, policy and RBAC continue to be a top priority. As we near the completion of migrating keystone's own policies to understand system scope and default roles, we need to look forward to driving these changes across the rest of OpenStack while ensuring as smooth a transition as possible for operators and end users. Beyond that, my top focus will be on incrementally improving the quality of keystone as a product, starting with enhancing our testing to ensure it is more stable and reliable and encompasses all the scenarios that are important to us, from rolling upgrades to federation to performance testing. As more and more we face a simple lack of people-hours within the team to drive massive features, my strategy will be to remove roadblocks like CI issues and technical debt in order to empower new and existing contributors to drive the features they want to see in keystone, whether that is quota limits, federation enhancements, better support for Edge use cases, or whatever other life-improving ideas come up. Thank you for your consideration, Colleen (cmurphy)

commit_message:
Adding Micha Dulko candidacy for Kuryr U PTL

Change-Id: I01e04d576f6f48ae373244f05f262cd764cc901f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/election refs/changes/15/679015/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Hello, I'm writing this to announce my candidacy for Kuryr Project Team Lead in the U cycle. As you probably already know Daniel Mellado was unable to continue serving as the PTL for Kuryr in the middle of Train cycle. I was nominated to take the role for the rest of the cycle and would like to continue during the U timeframe. I see following goals for the Kuryr project during the U timeframe: * Stabilization of kuryr-kubernetes: * Codebase had grown extensively, we need to take a step back and address technical debt we created. * Improve functional testing of new features. * Work on kuryr-controller's stability. * Clarifying situation of kuryr and kuryr-libnetwork: * As there was virtually no contribution besides housekeeping on the openstack/kuryr project, we should consider extracting the kuryr.lib and retiring the project. * kuryr-libnetwork situation is a bit different as it's used by Zun and contribution statistics during Train cycle look a bit better. Anyway clarifying the way forward would be a good thing to do in U cycle. Thanks, Micha Dulko (dulek)

commit_message:
Fix for k8s client annotation

This commit changes the behaviour of k8s client
while annotating. K8s client should not throw exceptions
if there are conflicts in data and resourceVersion
is different. It should resolve conflicts properly
and try to patch annotations once again changing
resourceVersion.

If data is the same in process of annotating, then
k8s client should not annotate many times.

Change-Id: I7d981b59ecdae7fe434fe580f2f342cc4621198e
Signed-off-by: Danil Golov <d.golov@samsung.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes refs/changes/70/670770/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: if v != retrieved_annotations.get(k, v): # No conflicting annotations found. Retry patching resource_version = new_version continue LOG.debug("Annotations for %(path)s already present: " "%(names)s", {'path': path, 'names': retrieved_annotations})

commit_message:
WIP Ensure svc without selectors are processed

Kuryr will skip the svc without endpoints so it does need to
skip svc without selectors. This way if endpoints are added
this svc will also be handled by kuryr

Change-Id: I93114b9b9132c0b078f3402ebe64c60518ec3dc1

Identify Cinder as the Block Storage Service

According to openstack/governance/projects.yaml, Cinder is the
OpenStack Block Storage service.  This patch changes the specs
index page to reflect this.

commit_message:
WIP: Report PCPU to placement

This patch does following things:
1. 'NUMACell' and 'InstanceNUMACell' object ready to accept 'PCPU'.
2. Added below conf option under 'compute' section:
    [compute]
    cpu_dedicated_set
3. Parse new config option CONF.compute.cpu_dedicated_set
   at libvirt driver side.
4. Populate the 'pcpuset' field of NUMACell object.
5. Report PCPU inventory to placement.

Partially Implements: blueprint cpu-resources
Change-Id: I1f10d09643d0d15d76b167b817183b989f52625d

commit_message:
WIP: Virt driver: Build guest xml

This patch does following things:
1. Prepare VCPU and PCPU resources from flavor extra-specs for
   getting allocations from placement side.
2. Populate InstanceNUMATopology object with requested
   numa topology for guest.
3. Building guest xml at libvirt driver side with the help of new
   InstanceNUMATopology object.

Partially Implements: blueprint cpu-resources
Change-Id: I0e054385c36e66f7c6b4f48ea1737a964a295221

commit_message:
WIP: Add scheduler request filter to alias cpu_policy

Added scheduler request filter to alias ``hw:cpu_policy``
set in flavor extra spec or image properties to
``resources=(V|P)CPU:${flavor.vcpus}`` and
``hw:cpu_thread_policy``  to
``trait:HW_CPU_HYPERTHREADING=required|isolate``.

Partially Implements: blueprint cpu-resources

Change-Id: Ia764ee81abc3743276f40505f3a1df151ba5085d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/23/672223/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import refrom oslo_utils import strutilsfrom nova.objects import fieldsRESOURCES_PCPU = re.compile("resources([0-9]*):PCPU") RESOURCES_VCPU = re.compile("resources([0-9]*):VCPU")def alias_flavor_extra_specs(ctxt, request_spec): """Alias flavor extra specs. This will modify request_spec old flavor extra specs to new flavor extra spec for cpu pinning to request hosts which will statisfy the user's request. """ flavor = request_spec.flavor specs = flavor['extra_specs'] if 'extra_specs' in flavor else {} cpu_policy_flavor_extra = specs.get('hw:cpu_policy') cpu_policy_image_meta = request_spec.image.properties.get('hw_cpu_policy') cpu_thread_policy = specs.get('hw:cpu_thread_policy') image_cpu_thread_policy = request_spec.image.properties.get( 'hw_cpu_thread_policy') image_required_traits = request_spec.image.properties.get( 'traits_required') resources_vcpus = 0 resources_pcpus = 0 for key, value in specs.items(): if RESOURCES_PCPU.match(key): if strutils.is_int_like(value): resources_pcpus += int(value) if RESOURCES_VCPU.match(key): if strutils.is_int_like(value): resources_vcpus += int(value) # If both resources:PCPU and resources:VCPU are requested in the same # flavor then raise exception. if resources_vcpus != 0 and resources_pcpus != 0: raise exception.RequestFilterFailed(reason=_( "Both VCPU and PCPU resources cannot be requested in a single " "request.")) # If cpu_policy is set in the image properties or flavor extra specs, # then it is expected that flavor extra specs shouldn't request for # VCPU or PCPU with syntax "resources:VCPU=2" and/or "resources:PCPU=2". if ((resources_pcpus != 0 or resources_vcpus != 0) and (cpu_policy_flavor_extra or cpu_policy_image_meta)): raise exception.RequestFilterFailed(reason=_( "VCPU and/or PCPU resources are requested in flavor extra specs " "so it doesn't allow you to request cpu_policy in flavor extra " "specs or image properties.")) # alias flavor extra specs hw:cpu_policy=dedicated|shared to # resources:PCPU|VCPU if cpu_policy_flavor_extra == fields.CPUAllocationPolicy.DEDICATED: request_spec.flavor.extra_specs['resources:PCPU'] = flavor.vcpus elif cpu_policy_flavor_extra == fields.CPUAllocationPolicy.SHARED: request_spec.flavor.extra_specs['resources:VCPU'] = flavor.vcpus # alias hw:cpu_thread_policy to trait:HW_CPU_HYPERTHREADING if cpu_thread_policy: if cpu_thread_policy == fields.CPUThreadAllocationPolicy.ISOLATE: request_spec.flavor.extra_specs['trait:HW_CPU_HYPERTHREADING' ] = 'forbidden' elif cpu_thread_policy == fields.CPUThreadAllocationPolicy.REQUIRE: request_spec.flavor.extra_specs['trait:HW_CPU_HYPERTHREADING' ] = 'required' elif image_cpu_thread_policy == fields.CPUThreadAllocationPolicy.REQUIRE: if image_required_traits: request_spec.image.properties.traits_required.append( 'HW_CPU_HYPERTHREADING') else: request_spec.image.properties.traits_required = [ 'HW_CPU_HYPERTHREADING']

commit_message:
WIP Upgrade patch to handle PCPU resource

Added upgrade code using reshape to report PCPU instead of VCPU in
case the host is configured to use pinned CPUs.

This patch does following things:

1. Handled all the configuration related errors.
2. Enable scheduler pre-filter 'alias_flavor_extra_specs'.
3. Any existing compute node running guests which uses dedicated CPUs
   is upgraded to Train release, it will update allocation records of
   existing guest from VCPU to PCPU using the reshape functionality.

Implements: blueprint cpu-resources
Change-Id: Ie272a11cb4f069320e6f7bfeb5a3bc25333eeff0

commit_message:
Revert "Handle defined containers that are stopped."

It is causing some containers (memcached) to be re-created at
every run, with the unique name. We need to rework the code
as well as it's breaking pacemaker-managed containers.
This reverts commit 85fb2ed4d3f7e42840842f2bdec617e33d6ba4ef.

Change-Id: I22d3eb35dced8178fe6beb0c76c855746efdf94d

and that will also be overridden. discover_container_name.return_value = None inspect.return_value = {"State": {"Running": False}} remove_container.return_value = ('stdout', 'stderr', 0) execute.return_value = ('stdout', 'stderr', 0) # Run the main apply() method for this test. stdout, stderr, deploy_status_code = builder.apply() pull_missing_images.assert_called_once() container_names.assert_called_once() unique_container_name.assert_called_once() delete_missing_and_updated.assert_called()

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-08-27 13:07:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/ce10e8e7937a23fe322187f16acf2c6a62fa9197', 'message': "The best effort pre-upgrade online data migrations were an attempt to
mitigate possible user errors if users forget to run the online data
migrations explicitly during the previous upgrade. However, they ended
up causing more problems than good:

* If user follows docs, they are unnecessary.

* If the containers for the services aren't running, they will get
  silently ignored already. This was done to facilitate re-runs of
  failed upgrade steps and prevent false failures. If the upgrade
  includes an operating system change, the pre-upgrade migrations will
  simply not run.

* However, if the containers for the services are running but the
  database is not running or is not functional for some reason, the
  migration will be attempted and the upgrade will get stuck. This
  leads to confusing errors not really related to the root cause of
  the problem, and non-straightforward breakages where the fix might
  otherwise be just to re-run the upgrade.

For the above reasons this commit removes the pre-upgrade just-in-case
online data migrations. We should be running them only as documented

Closes-Bug: #1841590

commit_message:
Remove pre-upgrade best-effort online data migrations

The best effort pre-upgrade online data migrations were an attempt to
mitigate possible user errors if users forget to run the online data
migrations explicitly during the previous upgrade. However, they ended
up causing more problems than good:

* If user follows docs, they are unnecessary.

* If the containers for the services aren't running, they will get
  silently ignored already. This was done to facilitate re-runs of
  failed upgrade steps and prevent false failures. If the upgrade
  includes an operating system change, the pre-upgrade migrations will
  simply not run.

* However, if the containers for the services are running but the
  database is not running or is not functional for some reason, the
  migration will be attempted and the upgrade will get stuck. This
  leads to confusing errors not really related to the root cause of
  the problem, and non-straightforward breakages where the fix might
  otherwise be just to re-run the upgrade.

For the above reasons this commit removes the pre-upgrade just-in-case
online data migrations. We should be running them only as documented
in the upgrade workflow.

Change-Id: I5d3cc863f138d4f1a915e8a2060dd9ed1d577f37
Closes-Bug: #1841590

commit_message:
zuul: add openstack/magnum to opendev

vexxhost/kue is a library that would like to make changes against
checked-out versions of openstack/magnum in gate (enabling us
to use things like Depends-On).

This change adds nothing but the project in order to allow us to
be able to do Depends-On.

Change-Id: I0c1abcd212c016bf15a18cb6f5c2554256fdb502

commit_message:
Add [elections] ML subject tag

The technical election officials use an [elections] subject tag on
all election-related communications to the openstack-discuss and
openstack-announce mailing lists, so record that in the open
community document along with the other recommended tags.

Change-Id: I2881ca7c432ad85d4b3d535b02086be6e83412bc

commit_message:
Add encoding to local_settings.py

In order to allow usage of non-latin symbols inside local_settings.py
magic comment is required according to PEP263[1]

While this can be overriden on master with config_template (since [2]),
this might be easily backported to earlier releases.

[1] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0263/
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/672170/

Change-Id: I9b07cf4a1ffdffab752f59e1510796c29a259b45
(cherry picked from commit 7bb294b92a61ea1bebcdce1943f48ffaf5c1cdee)

commit_message:
Added some more output in logs in case of failure for "execute"

If a command fails, it might be good to output the reason it failed, not
only the exit code.

Change-Id: Iaf023f0e86b2baca64cc60c853b7f726ad77fa0e
Closes-Bug: 1731185

commit_message:
Change python3.5 job to python3.7 job on Stein+

python3.5 was the only supported python3 version on Xenial, now that we have
Bionic Beaver nodes that support python3.7, lets switch to testing with
python3.7 in addition with python3.6 in Stein and beyond.
See ML discussion here [1] for context.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135632.html

Change-Id: I798072e948d70bbc7b7e56d77229cf8d456fdcca
Signed-off-by: Charles Short <chucks@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.concurrency refs/changes/09/610109/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: envlist = py37,py27,pep8

commit_message:
Add *_container_cli settings to extras-common

Previously, these settings were added to feature sets
and dupicated in each one. This review single-sources
the settinge so they are not left out in certain
feature sets.

commit_message:
Out-of-band `erase_devices` clean step for Proliant Servers

This commit adds new management interface `ilo5` to support an
out-of-band clean step for sanitize disk erase on ilo5 based
Proliant Servers.

Change-Id: I7b9fc6add6f6a616bdee4d94cb577e7a27a794e5
Story: #2006394
Task: #36269
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/82/641582/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from futurist import periodics class Ilo5Management(IloManagement): def _set_driver_internal_true_value(self, task, *keys): driver_internal_info = task.node.driver_internal_info for key in keys: driver_internal_info[key] = True task.node.driver_internal_info = driver_internal_info task.node.save() def _pop_driver_internal_values(self, task, *keys): driver_internal_info = task.node.driver_internal_info for key in keys: driver_internal_info.pop(key, None) task.node.driver_internal_info = driver_internal_info task.node.save() def _set_clean_failed(self, task, msg, exc): LOG.error("Sanitize disk erase job failed for node %(node)s. " "Message: '%(message)s'.", {'node': task.node.uuid, 'message': msg}) task.node.last_error = msg task.process_event('fail') @METRICS.timer('Ilo5Management._query_disk_erase_job_status') @periodics.periodic(spacing=CONF.ilo.query_disk_erase_job_status_interval, enabled=CONF.ilo.enable_periodic_task_for_disk_erase) def _query_disk_erase_job_status(self, manager, context): """Periodic task to check the progress of running disk erase jobs.""" filters = {'reserved': False, 'provision_state': states.CLEANWAIT, 'maintenance': False, 'driver': 'ilo5'} fields = ['driver_internal_info'] node_list = manager.iter_nodes(fields=fields, filters=filters) for (node_uuid, driver, conductor_group, driver_internal_info) in node_list: try: lock_purpose = 'checking async sanitize disk erase jobs' with task_manager.acquire(context, node_uuid, purpose=lock_purpose, shared=True) as task: driver_internal_info = task.node.driver_internal_info if not isinstance(task.driver.management, Ilo5Management): continue disk_erase_hdd_status = driver_internal_info.get( 'ilo_disk_erase_hdd_in_progress') disk_erase_ssd_status = driver_internal_info.get( 'ilo_disk_erase_ssd_in_progress') if not (disk_erase_hdd_status and disk_erase_ssd_status): continue task.upgrade_lock() task.node.touch_provisioning() try: ilo_object = ilo_common.get_ilo_object(task.node) if disk_erase_status: if ilo_object.has_disk_erase_completed() LOG.debug("For node %(uuid)s disk erase clean " "step is done.", {'uuid': task.node.uuid}) _pop_driver_internal_values(task, 'disk_erase_in_progress') task.node.driver_internal_info = ( driver_internal_info) task.node.save() manager_utils.notify_conductor_resume_clean(task) except ilo_error.IloError as ilo_exception: self._set_clean_failed(task, ilo_exception) except exception.NodeNotFound: LOG.info("During query of disk erase clean step, node " "%(node)s was not found and presumed deleted by " "another process.", {'node': node_uuid}) except exception.NodeLocked: LOG.info("During query of disk erase clean step, node " "%(node)s was already locked by another process. " "Skip.", {'node': node_uuid}) @METRICS.timer('Ilo5Management.erase_devices') @base.clean_step(priority=0, abortable=False) def erase_devices(self, task): """Erase all the drives on this server. This method performs sanitize erase on all the supported physical drives in this server. This erase cannot be performed on logical drives. :param task: a TaskManager instance. :raises: NodeCleaningFailure, on failure to execute step. """ node = task.node driver_internal_info = node.driver_internal_info LOG.debug("Calling out-of-band sanitize disk erase for node %(node)s", {'node': node.uuid}) try: ilo_object = ilo_common.get_ilo_object(node) controllers = ilo_object.get_smart_storage_controllers() if not driver_internal_info.get('ilo_disk_erase_hdd_in_progress'): for controller, disk_type in controllers: if disk_type['HDD']: ilo_object.do_disk_erase(controller, 'HDD') manager_utils.node_power_action(task, states.REBOOT) self._set_driver_internal_true_value( task, 'ilo_disk_erase_hdd_in_progress', 'cleaning_reboot', 'skip_current_clean_step') return states.CLEANWAIT elif not driver_internal_info.get('ilo_disk_erase_ssd_in_progress'): for controller, disk_type in controllers: if disk_type['SSD']: ilo_object.do_disk_erase(controller, 'SSD') manager_utils.node_power_action(task, states.REBOOT) self._set_driver_internal_true_value( task, 'ilo_disk_erase_ssd_in_progress', 'cleaning_reboot') return states.CLEANWAIT except ilo_error.IloError as ilo_exception: operation = (_("Failed to perform sanitize disk erase on node %s") % node.uuid) self._pop_driver_internal_values(task, 'ilo_disk_erase_hdd_in_progress', 'ilo_disk_erase_ssd_in_progress', 'cleaning_reboot', 'skip_current_clean_step') node.driver_internal_info = driver_internal_info node.save() self._set_clean_failed(task, operation, ilo_exception)

Processes like ovn-northd and ovsdb-servers were not spawned as daemons.

commit_message:
functional: Fix reading from process pipes

Processes like ovn-northd and ovsdb-servers were not spawned as daemons.
That means processes were writing to stdout and stderr but the code has
actually never read anything. It caused processes to hang after a while
once the buffers got full.

This patch makes processes being spawned as daemons - see manpages for
more information about --detach paramter. Daemon spawns another child
process and its pid is written to its pidfile. Such pidfile is used when
there a need to deal with the process.

Closes-bug: #1837373

Change-Id: I63074fad823362ec6e8a2cad796e258ca200ad3a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/26/672026/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Long story short, we need to rescan after making

commit_message:
Rescan after making partition changes

Long story short, we need to rescan after making
partition changes.

Without forcing a filesystem sync and rescan operation,
we rely upon lazy write-out from buffers to the block
device when operating with a ramdisk.

This is because ramfs does NOT actually operate with fsync
where as GNU parted utilizes fsync on the device in an
attempt to force the write to disk to occur. This is fine
if your booted with devfs, or say even a physical block
device that backs /dev, just not ramfs.

Change-Id: I66481d5f3c17a489f7bdf0af82e31b9107605968
Story: 2006423
Task: 36316
(cherry picked from commit 2a83c0add09abee2c12bc76658a66e253f236f95)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-lib refs/changes/64/677764/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | Fixes an issue with the ``disk_utils`` method ``make_partitions``, which is utilized to facilitate the write-out of partition images to disk. Previously when this method was invoked on a ramdisk, the partition may not have been found.

commit_message:
Moves monasca-thresh java.io.tmpdir to existing docker volume

This prevents the container's root filesystem from filling up.

Change-Id: Icc5a08c82312d6688edf2ef36562967ac94e8ac9
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/674779
Closes-Bug: #1839149
(cherry picked from commit df93d31fe06b8e6522f892281e57c4d4681b1975)

commit_message:
Modify grep rule to identify 'Clone Set' resources

Current filter rule gets wrong results in transient condition.
This commit changes the grep filter rule to increase the robustness of
the result.

Closes-Bug: #1839910

Change-Id: I92aba5bc7eb9e8a90d6a2c321b3a2a20414f1779
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ha-utils refs/changes/92/676092/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Change-Id: Iec11b83ade6d8441ce5ece1f3d3d9f73206fd9e4
'}]
commit_message:
Fix malformed InfluxDB query (LIMIT and OFFSET inverted)

In the method `InfluxClient::retrieve`, `LIMIT` and `OFFSET`
are inverted causing the query to systemically fail when
pagination is asked.

In InfluxQL, it seems that `LIMIT` must be before `OFFSET`.

More tests have been added to ensure that the correct format
is used inside the problematic method.

Change-Id: Iec11b83ade6d8441ce5ece1f3d3d9f73206fd9e4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cloudkitty refs/changes/82/678882/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: query += ' LIMIT {} OFFSET {}'.format(limit, offset)

commit_message:
Add digestmod when using hmac

Until Python 3.8 hmc.new() defaulted the digestmod argument to 'hmac-md5'.
This was deperecated, to be removed in Python 3.8 [1], so let's get
ready for new python.

Also switching to more secure sha1 algorithm, using md5 anywhere may
trigger alerts from automatic security tools.

[1] https://docs.python.org/3.8/library/hmac.html

Change-Id: I4b365cb05de98bdd498b3c2094e4a77ab3944b12
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.utils refs/changes/70/677770/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import hashlib _gen_digest = lambda text: hmac.new(b'foo', text.encode('utf-8'), digestmod=hashlib.md5).digest()

commit_message:
Moves monasca-thresh java.io.tmpdir to existing docker volume

This prevents the container's root filesystem from filling up.

Change-Id: Icc5a08c82312d6688edf2ef36562967ac94e8ac9
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/674779
Closes-Bug: #1839149
(cherry picked from commit df93d31fe06b8e6522f892281e57c4d4681b1975)

commit_message:
Add undercloud-key-file and ssh_network options.

To enable the execution via ssh into the Undercloud node it's
required to pass also the ansible_ssh_user private key. This
options is part of the tripleo_common inventory.py, but defaults
to None.
This patch allows to pass this parameter in case it's needed.

Also, this patch allows to pass a different value for the host_network
parameter in TripleoInventory instantiation. Setting it by default to
ctlplane.

Change-Id: Id303f356c1b06906aa5aae43b0032bb80a712508
Related-Bug: #1832932
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-validations refs/changes/15/676415/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cfg.StrOpt('undercloud-key-file', default=None), undercloud_key_file=configs.undercloud_key_file,

subject: Provide a proper way to choose VF in CNI
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-04-30 09:25:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes/commit/07be0d99d9cdabd8c8304e83b924fa917642cb3d', 'message': "Provide a proper way to choose VF in CNI

This commit fixes incorrect way for choosing VF in
SR-IOV binding driver.

Previously sriov-device-plugin has choosen device
by it's own way while CNI choosed first available VF.
This entities did not know anything about each other's
choice.

Now SR-IOV binding driver gets a list of used by
kubelet devices with help of Pod Resources Client, then
chooses device from this list which is not used by pod
yet and passes an appropriate VF into container's
network namespace.

Change-Id: I5b24981f715966369b05b8ab157f8bfe02afc2d4
Closes-Bug: 1826865
Signed-off-by: Danil Golov <d.golov@samsung.com>

commit_message:
Provide a proper way to choose VF in CNI

This commit fixes incorrect way for choosing VF in
SR-IOV binding driver.

Previously sriov-device-plugin has choosen device
by it's own way while CNI choosed first available VF.
This entities did not know anything about each other's
choice.

Now SR-IOV binding driver gets a list of used by
kubelet devices with help of Pod Resources Client, then
chooses device from this list which is not used by pod
yet and passes an appropriate VF into container's
network namespace.

Also this commit contains tools for cluster upgrade.

Change-Id: I5b24981f715966369b05b8ab157f8bfe02afc2d4
Closes-Bug: 1826865
Signed-off-by: Danil Golov <d.golov@samsung.com>

added_lines: vif.pod_name = pod_name vif.pod_link = pod['metadata']['selfLink']

subject: Check if container is running before doing an exec
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-08-22 02:07:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/paunch/commit/dd78c6d14cbd2294d9b4a66a5c8258cc7646f5c0', 'message': 'runner/discover_container_name: force ps --sync when podman

Running "podman ps --sync (...)" is expensive but it is needed to
avoid race conditions when the containers are started.
This flag forces a sync of Podman's state against the OCI
runtime, resolving some state desync errors

Closes-Bug: #1839559
Change-Id: If4d8c268218bf83abed877a699fc583fb55ccbed
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2019-08-22 04:00:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/paunch/commit/61d6fb0e18321383ed19918f4b4a4245459d0d7c', 'message': 'WIP - runner/discover_container_name: drop -a and force -sync for podman ps

Running "podman ps --sync (...)" is expensive but it is needed to
avoid race conditions when the containers are started.
This flag forces a sync of Podman's state against the OCI
runtime, resolving some state desync errors.

Also, removing the -a to only list the running containers.

Closes-Bug: #1839559
Change-Id: If4d8c268218bf83abed877a699fc583fb55ccbed
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2019-08-22 14:40:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/paunch/commit/f03e144afe79439510fe6bbfdf3c91d5420be27b', 'message': 'WIP - introduce container_running() and use it before running podman exec

container_running is a new method which will allow to return True if a
container is detected as running or False if not running.
There is a retry mechanism which if "podman ps" is used, will add "--sync" to
the command so we synchronize the state of OCI runtime.

It will be first used by the builder when a container is configured to
run "podman exec"; we'll first verify that the container exist otherwise
return an error.

TODO:
- add systemd support
- figure out if we need a sleep in the while between each iterations (in ms)

Co-Authored-By: Cdric Jeanneret <cjeanner@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1839559
Change-Id: If4d8c268218bf83abed877a699fc583fb55ccbed
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2019-08-22 16:08:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/paunch/commit/645999d233c357e7bd15d0e6612dec862b91cc18', 'message': 'WIP - introduce container_running() and use it before running podman exec

commit_message:
Check if container is running before doing an exec

container_running is a new method which will allow to return True if a
container is detected as running or False if not running.
There is a retry mechanism which if "podman ps" is used, will add "--sync" to
the command so we synchronize the state of OCI runtime. Before doing a
"podman ps", we try to check if the service is running in systemd.
There is a very short sleep between the retries to give a chance to
podman to find the container if it takes a bit of time to start or seen
as started.

It will be used by the builder when a container is configured to
run "podman exec"; we'll first verify that the container exist otherwise
return an error and stop the deployment.

This patch is mainly a workaround against a race condition where in
heavy-loaded environments, an exec can be run too early in a step where
the container is still starting.

It also consolidate the discover_container_name method in order to get
more chance to actually get a name.

Co-Authored-By: Cdric Jeanneret <cjeanner@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1839559
Change-Id: If4d8c268218bf83abed877a699fc583fb55ccbed
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/paunch refs/changes/60/677860/21 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Running "podman ps --sync (...)" is expensive but it is needed to # avoid race conditions when the containers are started. # This flag forces a sync of Podman's state against the OCI # runtime, resolving some state desync errors # https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1839559 # https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1739224 if self.cont_cmd == 'podman': cmd.append('--sync')

commit_message:
Do not wait for console being started on timeout

Current logic tries to call communicate on Popen object when
starting shellinabox console even if console.subprocess_timeout
is hit. This blocks until the command is finished, with timeout
having no effect on it. It means that node lock is not released
until communicate call finishes.

Story: 2006429
Task: 36333
Change-Id: Ic7b878cd432990218a3d87047905ce0828b8da2a

commit_message:
Updating the website for the Shanghai Summit

This patch updates the index page for the website to update the list if
upcoming training occasions. It also updates the page that contains
the training details for the Shanghai Summit.

Change-Id: Ic9a2af20e9b1101a959fd431fc8e9b8d5ee8791a

subject: Catch any exception when trying to call "git"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-08-22 04:58:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstackdocstheme/commit/379f363bb496d1734484887b9daef8c7c195ec6d', 'message': 'Catch any exception when trying to call "git"

Some projects (like Neutron) do import eventlet in docs/source/conf.py
. eventlet patches the subprocess module and due to that, the
submodule.CalledProcessError exception is not catched. So building the
documentation from an sdist tarball without having git installed (this
combination is common in package build envs) fails with:

subprocess.CalledProcessError: Command '['git', 'log', '-n1', \
  '--format=%ad', [...snipped...]

Change-Id: Ibff93605996855f01ba2bbe793285674b5c71d2e
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2019-08-22 05:01:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstackdocstheme/commit/605f89e5e0f760cb0312fe9bc57db17bc041a753', 'message': 'Catch any exception when trying to call "git"

. eventlet patches the subprocess module and due to that, the

commit_message:
Catch any exception when trying to call "git"

Some projects (like Neutron) do import eventlet in docs/source/conf.py
. eventlet patches the subprocess module and due to that, the
submodule.CalledProcessError exception is not caught. So building the
documentation from an sdist tarball with having git installed (this
combination is common in package build envs like RDO) fails with:

subprocess.CalledProcessError: Command '['git', 'log', '-n1', \
  '--format=%ad', [...snipped...]

Change-Id: Ibff93605996855f01ba2bbe793285674b5c71d2e

commit_message:
Fix trailing slashes for container locations

docker.io doesn't like urls that container double slashes which can lead
to incorrect auth problems. We should ensure that we are not
constructing any urls with double slashes when processing uploads.

Change-Id: If8626b7f0828e5c108107854274257cd3e8d53eb
Closes-Bug: #1841203

commit_message:
Remove openSUSE 42.3 job

openSUSE 42.3 is dead, remove the job, we test with openSUSE 15 now (as
on master). This allows to remove the nodes from CI.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/677947
Change-Id: Ia4e98bd3b6368bcde02dc7376fa4441b8e577e12

subject: Pass neutron-ovs.yaml environment in upgrade prepare.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-07-10 10:56:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-upgrade/commit/1db763e05b73887d1eb35236e960fe4a4c0ee0ad', 'message': 'Pass neutron-ovs.yaml environment in upgrade prepare.

If the environmet is deployed in Rocky with OVS then we need to pass
the neutron-ovs.yml environment file for the upgrade prepare step to
work. Otherwise, as OVN is the Neutron engine by default in Stein it
will try to deploy with OVN and the upgrade will fail.

This way, we first upgrade from Rocky with OVS to Stein to OVS and
in a post-upgrade step the upgrade from OVS to OVN would be performed.

Change-Id: I21bbf9cda977a1c269e2c1caad4bf88d3f6173b0
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2019-07-10 15:28:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-upgrade/commit/9b7e63691b9425b6b81aff8f4810cc56f6d5a37a', 'message': 'Pass neutron-ovs.yaml environment in upgrade prepare.

If the environmet is deployed in Rocky with OVS then we need to pass
the neutron-ovs.yml environment file for the upgrade prepare step to
work. Otherwise, as OVN is the Neutron engine by default in Stein it
will try to deploy with OVN and the upgrade will fail.

This way, we first upgrade from Rocky with OVS to Stein to OVS and
in a post-upgrade step the upgrade from OVS to OVN would be performed.

Change-Id: I21bbf9cda977a1c269e2c1caad4bf88d3f6173b0
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2019-07-11 06:33:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-upgrade/commit/33b3595150dd32d2f51eea3a95f439dcb8fec1e1', 'message': 'Pass neutron-ovs.yaml environment in upgrade prepare.

If the environmet is deployed in Rocky with OVS then we need to pass
the neutron-ovs.yml environment file for the upgrade prepare and converge
steps to work. Otherwise, as OVN is the Neutron engine by default in
Stein it will try to deploy with OVN and the upgrade will fail.

This way, we first upgrade from Rocky with OVS to Stein with OVS and
if required, a post-upgrade step to upgrade from OVS to OVN would be
performed.

Change-Id: I21bbf9cda977a1c269e2c1caad4bf88d3f6173b0
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2019-07-11 10:10:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-upgrade/commit/6aa8b0ef9d905b274870d75f403234d7cad19b71', 'message': 'Pass neutron-ovs.yaml environment in upgrade prepare.

If the environmet is deployed in Rocky with OVS then we need to pass
the neutron-ovs.yml environment file for the upgrade prepare and converge
steps to work. Otherwise, as OVN is the Neutron engine by default in
Stein it will try to deploy with OVN and the upgrade will fail.

Also, the containers-prepare-parameter.yaml is shared between the UC
and the OC upgrade. For the case of the UC, there is no possibility to
deploy with ovn, so we force the neutron_driver option (defaulted to ovn
when creating the default containers-prepare-parameter.yaml file) to
openvswitch. However, for the OC, we need to identify if it was deployed
with the OVN service enabled and if so, set the netron_driver to ovn instead.

In summary, we first upgrade from Rocky with OVS to Stein with OVS and
if required, a post-upgrade step to upgrade from OVS to OVN would be
performed. In the case the Rocky deployment was with OVN enabled we
perform a Rocky with OVN to Stein with OVN upgrade.

Change-Id: I21bbf9cda977a1c269e2c1caad4bf88d3f6173b0
'}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2019-07-11 13:18:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-upgrade/commit/7e1090bcfc7aec529619ce5012ddf23c038ec8b4', 'message': 'Pass neutron-ovs.yaml environment in upgrade prepare.
